publicationStmt.p: for use by whoever wants it

body.p: My TEI Customization starts with modules tei, core, textstructure and header

moduleRef.except: addrLine binaryObject choice corr del desc distinct divGen expan gb gloss headItem headLabel listBibl measureGrp milestone name num orig reg rs said sic sp speaker stage time
argument closer dateline div1 div2 div3 div4 div5 div6 div7 docDate docEdition docImprint docTitle epigraph floatingText group imprimatur opener postscript salute signed titlePage titlePart trailer
alt altGrp anchor join joinGrp link linkGrp timeline when
age climate geo geogFeat geogName listNym location nym offset person personGrp population socecStatus terrain trait

elementSpec.desc: Contains a catalog number for a musical work, such as "op. 6" or "K.467" The particular catalog used can be specified in the type attribute.
contains instrumentation that appears with work titles.
Contains a dedication that appears with a work, especially in a works list.

moduleRef.except: catDesc catRef category classCode classDecl funder geoDecl handNote interpretation principal samplingDecl scriptNote taxonomy typeNote

elementSpec.desc: designates a genre in a works list.

attDef.desc: identifies the delivery number (Nachlieferung) for a publication published in multiple deliveries over time.
classifies the title according to typographical conventions. Works can be in any medium

provides a sub-categorization of the element. Used here to distinguish "secondary" titles in MGG bibliographies, which are rendered differently, typographically. "primary" is only required in unusual cases where there might be ambiguity.

elementSpec.desc: contains information about a person's baptism, such as its date and place.
contains biographical information about a person. May contain a mix of text and elements.

attDef.desc: provides a sub-categorization of the element. Used here to distinguish "secondary" authors in MGG bibliographies, which are rendered differently, typographically. "primary" is only required in unusual cases where there might be ambiguity.
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
used to specify further information about the entity referenced by a name if role is not that of a editor.

provides a sub-categorization of the element. Used here to distinguish "primary" contributors in MGG bibliographies, which are rendered differently, typographically. "secondary" is only required in unusual cases where there might be ambiguity.

elementSpec.desc: Contains a note that is either part of the text or editorial.
Contains the name of a pitch in scientific pitch notation, Helmholtz pitch notation, or any other system.
Contains the name of a musical note without reference to a particular octave or pitch.

moduleRef.except: accMat acquisition additional additions adminInfo altIdentifier binding bindingDesc catchwords collation collection colophon condition custEvent custodialHist decoDesc decoNote depth dim dimensions explicit filiation finalRubric foliation handDesc height heraldry history institution layout layoutDesc locus locusGrp material msContents msDesc msIdentifier msItem msItemStruct msName msPart musicNotation objectDesc objectType origDate origPlace origin physDesc provenance recordHist repository rubric scriptDesc seal sealDesc secFol signatures source stamp summary support supportDesc surrogates typeDesc watermark width

elementSpec.desc: Contains the name of a key of a musical work. E.g. "A minor", "Fis-moll".
encodes the date, place, and other data about the performance of a work.

attDef.desc: "Ur" signifies the very first performance of a work; "first" can be an "first"--the first in a particular place, the first in a particular language, etc.

elementSpec.desc: Contains a reference to print a RISM Series B/I. Contains a year followed by a number.
contains information about a person's burial, such as its date and place.

attDef.desc: characterizes the type of organization. Use "uni" for any post-secondary educational institution.

elementSpec.desc: groups elements representing, describing, or containing a table.
Describes the duration, place, or other qualities of a series of events, such a a run of performances.

moduleRef.except: addSpan am damage damageSpan delSpan ex fw handNotes handShift line listTranspose metamark mod redo restore retrace sourceDoc space subst substJoin supplied surface surfaceGrp surplus transpose undo zone
